discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
The name similarity is not an issue, but

> Name is not at least 5 characters long

is more problematic (and I can't override it anyway). I would push for a longer, more descriptive name. `GaussianBosonicSystems` (which I assume is what `Gabs` derives from) seems perfectly suitable.

It also looks like the documentation is not deployed correctly: the links in the README do not work. It would also be good to add a paragraph or two to the README itself to give some idea of what the package is about, before people continue to the full docs.

discussion.author: apkille
discussion.text:
@goerz thanks for the feedback. I'm aware of JuliaRegistries policy of encouraging longer names for clarity even if they seem a little long winded, but `GaussianBosonicSystems` is pretty long. How about `GaussianBosons`?

I'll fix the doc deployment and update the README.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
> `GaussianBosonicSystems` is pretty long

Not by Julia standards ;-) But of course, when a package name becomes "too long" is matter of taste.

> How about `GaussianBosons`

Works for me!

discussion.author: apkille
discussion.text: @goerz Just a quick question: how much pushback is there on the name `Gabs`? I'd like something that is short, fun, and memorable if I can manage it.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: There's some discussion on the `#pgk-registration` channel on [Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/). The minimum line length rule is something that requires a manual merge by a full registry maintainer. So, at least one of them has to be okay with the name.

discussion.author: kellertuer
discussion.text: In my just very own personal opinion, the name `GaussianBosonicSystems` is more informative and helpful if someone is looking for a package and to that extend probably more “Julia-esque”.

discussion.author: ViralBShah
discussion.text: @apkille  Any thoughts on the proposed name?

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: We already discussed `GaussianBosonicSystems` above, and I definitely agree that the shorter `GaussianBosons` isn’t any less descriptive and thus probably a better choice. The question is really between that and the original `Gabs`

discussion.author: kellertuer
discussion.text: Sure the shorter one is also fine with me of course.

discussion.author: apkille
discussion.text: @ViralBShah @goerz @kellertuer I appreciate the discussion about this. In my own opinion (feel free to disagree), a name that is long and general such as `GaussianBosonicSystems` or `GaussianBosons` is not likely to propagate out of the Julia ecosystem. I would like this package to reach physicists who are generally interested in simulating continuous variable quantum information. There are exceptions, of course, but most well-known quantum packages (in Julia and beyond) have simple and fun names such as `Yao.jl`, `QuTiP`, `stim`, `mitiq`, to name a few. So, if possible, I would like to stick to `Gabs`.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: I feel like @apkille already expressed their thoughts: They’d prefer `Gabs` if there is a maintainer willing to merge it, or otherwise would rename to something that passes the automatic checks
